meanings.definition: The act or process of classifying into subcategories.
meanings.sent1: She organized the different types of fruits into subclassifications based on their colors.
meanings.sent2: The textbook included subclassifications for each chapter to help students study more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The subclassifications of animals at the zoo made the visitors laugh as they tried to find their favorite ones.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, the subclassifications of genres can be as diverse as a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: Her detailed subclassifications of plants made it easier for the botanists to identify each species.

meanings.definition: A specific category within a larger classification.
meanings.sent1: The novel fell into the subclassifications of mystery books in the library.
meanings.sent2: Each department in the company had its own subclassifications to streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent3: The subclassifications of ice cream flavors at the shop made choosing just one a difficult task.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the subclassifications of styles can be as varied as the colors of a sunset.
meanings.sent5: His subclassifications of cars based on their features helped buyers make informed decisions.
